DOC.brief_summary: To determine if there is a difference in the quality of life in between patients who undergoes laparoscopic transabdominal pre-peritoneal (TAPP) or modified Lichtenstein hernioplasty
DOC.brief_title: QOL in Incarcerated Inguinal Hernias: TAPP Vs Open Repair
DOC.detailed_description: Patients presenting with incarcerated inguinal hernias will be randomized between open or laparoscopic repair groups. The primary outcome will be the quality of life scores. Patients will be followed-up for 12 months.
DOC.criteria: 18 years of age and older Both genders Unilateral inguinal hernias Incarcerated inguinal hernias Elective setting Anaesthesiologists) Grade > 2 Recurrence Inguinalscrotal hernias Prostatectomy, Pfannenstiel incision, previous preperitoneal surgery Pregnancy Refusal for general anaesthesia
